message_1: What is the Z-score of an observation that has a value of 75 when the mean of the dataset is 50 and the standard deviation is 10? Determine whether this observation is an outlier or not by considering a commonly used threshold of +/-3 for the Z-score.
message_2:
To calculate the Z-score, we use the formula:

Z-score = (observation - mean) / standard deviation

In this case, the observation is 75, the mean is 50, and the standard deviation is 10. Plugging these values into the formula, we get:

Z-score = (75 - 50) / 10
Z-score = 25 / 10
Z-score = 2.5

The Z-score of the observation is 2.5. Since the commonly used threshold for outliers is +/-3, and the Z-score of 2.5 is within this range, the observation is not considered an outlier.
